alert.note: Alert for Woodward (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 09 at 2:57PM CDT until July 13 at 2:30AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma... North Canadian River near Woodward affecting Woodward County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...North Canadian River near Woodward. * WHEN...From late Tuesday night to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Shallow flooding of lowlands occurs along the river from the northwestern through the central and southeastern sections of Woodward County. Cattle and other property should be moved to locations higher than nearby river banks to avoid being stranded for hours by high water in side channels. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 4.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The North Canadian River is expected to rise above flood stage early Wednesday morning to a crest of 9.2 feet early Wednesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 300 AM CDT.
